item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 24, 2024 at 3:00 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Evidence of oldest known alphabetic writing unearthed in ancient Syrian city (128 points | 79 comments)
2. Bocker: Docker implemented in around 100 lines of Bash (2015) (74 points | 29 comments)
3. Ice base melt revealed by multibeam imagery of an Antarctic ice shelf (47 points | 1 comment)
4. Antenna Diodes in the Pentium Processor (127 points | 23 comments)
5. Continuous Integration Dashboard for Apache NuttX RTOS (Prometheus and Grafana) (38 points | discuss)
6. Highest-resolution images ever captured of the sun’s surface (389 points | 109 comments)
7. Establishing an etiquette for LLM use on Libera.Chat (41 points | 25 comments)
8. Size and albedo of the largest detected Oort-cloud object (82 points | 37 comments)
9. A century later, a taped message solves the mystery of a WWI doughboy's death (15 points | 1 comment)
10. A short introduction to Interval Tree Clocks (32 points | 4 comments)
11. Anti-scale: a response to AI in journalism (11 points | 1 comment)
12. The remarkable life and astonishing times of Dwight Smith Young (20 points | 1 comment)
13. Three hundred words you can spell on a calculator [pdf] (6 points | 3 comments)
14. Stack Analyser: detect technologies used inside a repo (25 points | 1 comment)
15. OpenMPTCProuter: Aggregate and encrypt multiple internet connections using MPTCP (133 points | 32 comments)
16. Using GPS in the Year 1565 (142 points | 18 comments)
17. 1 Dataset. 100 Visualizations (34 points | 9 comments)
18. Music as Language (2019) [pdf] (32 points | 4 comments)
19. The Physics of Butterfly Wings (39 points | 7 comments)
20. Quake 3 Source Code Review: Network Model (2012) (276 points | 60 comments)
21. Energy is frame-dependent, infrastructure of energy is frame-independent (2020) (8 points | 4 comments)
22. Dear sir, you have built a compiler (2022) (334 points | 187 comments)
23. MaXX Interactive Desktop -- the little brother of the great SGI Desktop on IRIX (141 points | 56 comments)
24. The biggest blocker to LibreOffice adoption? LibreOffice (6 points | 1 comment)
25. Computer Networking Fundamentals – Learning Series (2023) (135 points | 10 comments)
26. Baby’s Second Garbage Collector (125 points | discuss)
27. How to give a senior leader feedback (without getting fired) (141 points | 135 comments)
28. A silly science prize changed my career (93 points | 12 comments)
29. AI PCs make users less productive (21 points | 7 comments)
30. RGFW: Single-header C99 window abstraction library (149 points | 89 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 24, 2024 at 3:00 AM UTC
